verses.verse: And the LORD said to Moses, “How long (2 Kin. 17:14; Ps. 78:10; 106:13) do you refuse to keep My commandments and My laws?
See! For the LORD has given you the Sabbath; therefore He gives you on the sixth day bread for two days. Let every man remain in his place; let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.”
So the people rested on the seventh day.
And the house of Israel called its name Manna. And (Num. 11:7-9; Deut. 8:3, 16) it was like white coriander seed, and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.

Then Moses said, “This is the thing which the LORD has commanded: ‘Fill an omer with it, to be kept for your generations, that they may see the bread with which I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you out of the land of Egypt.’ ”
And Moses said to Aaron, (Heb. 9:4; Rev. 2:17) “Take a pot and put an omer of manna in it, and lay it up before the LORD, to be kept for your generations.”
As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up (Ex. 25:16, 21; 27:21; 40:20; Num. 17:10) before the Testimony, to be kept.

And the children of Israel (Deut. 8:3, 16) ate manna (Num. 33:38; John 6:31, 49) forty years, (Josh. 5:12; Neh. 9:20, 21) until they came to an inhabited land; they ate manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
Now an omer is one-tenth of an ephah.

Water from the Rock Then (Ex. 16:1) all the congregation of the children of Israel set out on their journey from the Wilderness of (Num. 33:11-15) Sin, according to the commandment of the LORD, and camped in Rephidim; but there was no water for the people to (Ex. 15:22; Num. 20:2) drink.

(Ex. 14:11; Num. 20:2, 3, 13) Therefore the people contended with Moses, and said, “Give us water, that we may drink.” So Moses said to them, “Why do you contend with me? Why do you ((Deut. 6:16); Ps. 78:18, 41; (Matt. 4:7); 1 Cor. 10:9) tempt the LORD?”

And the people thirsted there for water, and the people (Ex. 16:2, 3) complained against Moses, and said, “Why is it you have brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our (Ex. 12:38) livestock with thirst?”
So Moses (Ex. 14:15) cried out to the LORD, saying, “What shall I do with this people? They are almost ready to (John 8:59; 10:31) stone me!”
And the LORD said to Moses, (Ezek. 2:6) “Go on before the people, and take with you some of the elders of Israel. Also take in your hand your rod with which (Num. 20:8) you struck the river, and go.

(Num. 20:10, 11; Deut. 8:15; Neh. 9:15; Ps. 78:15; 105:41; 114:8; (1 Cor. 10:4)) Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock in Horeb; and you shall strike the rock, and water will come out of it, that the people may drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.

So he called the name of the place (Num. 20:13, 24; 27:14; Ps. 81:7) Massah and Meribah, because of the contention of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, “Is the LORD among us or not?”
